/wiki/1_Utama: 1 Utama Shopping Centre is situated in Bandar Utama, Damansara, Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia. Opened in 1995, its gross built-up area totals 5,592,015 square feet (519515²). It is the largest shopping mall in Malaysia and the seventh largest in the world.
/wiki/Petaling_Jaya: Petaling Jaya (commonly called "PJ" by locals) is a major Malaysian city originally developed as a satellite township for Kuala Lumpur. It is located in the Petaling District of Selangor with an area of approximately 97.2 square kilometres (37.5 sq mi). Petaling Jaya was granted city status on 20 June 2006.
/wiki/TGV_Cinemas: TGV Cinemas Sdn Bhd (formerly known as Tanjong Golden Village) is the second largest cinema chain in Malaysia. As of March 2019, TGV Cinemas has 35 multiplexes with 282 screens and more than 48,000 seats. TGV Cinemas is headquartered at Maxis Tower, Kuala Lumpur.
/wiki/Sunway_Pyramid: Sunway Pyramid is a shopping mall located in Bandar Sunway, Subang Jaya, Selangor which was developed by Sunway Group and opened in July 1997. It is Malaysia's first themed shopping and entertainment mall in an Egyptian design with a lion sculpture, Pharaoh statues and two domes, known as the Orange and blue Atrium both represent Sun God Ra and Great Nile river respectively form part of the building structure. The mall consists of several shopping precincts, which are Fashion Central, Oasis Boulevard, Asian Avenue and Marrakesh and comprises over 900 outlets, ranging from fashion, accessories, shoes, jewellery, timepieces, music, videos, gifts, souvenirs, leathers, books, pharmacies, electrical products, home furnishing, wellness to one-stop IT centre. Since its opening in 1997, Sunway Pyramid had undergone two expansions, in 2007 and again in 2015, increased the total area of the building to 396,000 m2 (4,260,000 sq ft).
/wiki/AEON_Bukit_Tinggi: The ÆON Bukit Tinggi Shopping Centre is a shopping mall built on a 26-acre (110,000 m2) landmass with a gross built-up floor area of approximately 2,100,000 square feet (200,000 m2). Also popularly known as Jusco Bukit Tinggi, the shopping mall is located in the Bandar Bukit Tinggi township, Klang, Selangor, Malaysia.The mall is the largest ÆON (JUSCO) shopping centre in Malaysia and Southeast Asia (and the largest in Asia). It is the first mall to have more leaseable space than Mid Valley Megamall.
/wiki/Klang,_Malaysia: Klang or Kelang, officially Royal Town of Klang (Malay: Bandar Diraja Klang), is a royal town and former capital of the state of Selangor, Malaysia. It is located within the Klang District. It was the civil capital of Selangor in an earlier era prior to the emergence of Kuala Lumpur and the current capital, Shah Alam. Port Klang, which is located in the Klang District, is the 12th busiest transshipment port and the 12th busiest container port in the world.
/wiki/Puchong: Puchong is a major town and a parliamentary constituency in the Petaling District, Selangor, Malaysia.
/wiki/Shah_Alam: Shah Alam /ʃɑː ˈɑːləm/ is a city and the state capital of Selangor, Malaysia and situated within the Petaling District and a small portion of the neighbouring Klang District. Shah Alam replaced Kuala Lumpur as the capital city of the state of Selangor in 1978 due to Kuala Lumpur's incorporation into a Federal Territory in 1974. Shah Alam was the first planned city in Malaysia after independence from Britain in 1957.
/wiki/Rawang,_Selangor: Rawang (Jawi: راوڠ) (Chinese: 万挠) (Tamil: ராவாங்) is a town and a mukim in Gombak District, Selangor, Malaysia, about 23 km northwest of city centre Kuala Lumpur.
/wiki/Balakong:
Balakong (無拉港) or Cheras South (蕉賴南區) is a township in Selangor, Malaysia. Balakong is situated exactly at the boundary of Cheras. The township consists mainly of residential condominiums, office complexes and factories. 
Landmark AEON Jusco Cheras Selatan Balakong and (星安庙〉Sin Ann Meow Temple .
/wiki/Cyberjaya: Cyberjaya (a portmanteau of cyber and Putrajaya) is a town with a science park as the core that forms a key part of the Multimedia Super Corridor in Malaysia. It is located in Sepang District, Selangor. Cyberjaya is adjacent to, and developed along with Putrajaya, Malaysia's new seat of government. This town aspires to be known as the Silicon Valley of Malaysia.
/wiki/Jaya_Shopping_Centre: Jaya Shopping Centre was redeveloped into an approximately 260,000 square feet lifestyle mall in 2014. It is located at Section 14, Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia.
/wiki/The_Mines: MINES Wellness City (formerly known as Mines Resort City) is an integrated Health and Wellness resort township in Seri Kembangan, Selangor, Malaysia.
/wiki/Seri_Kembangan: Seri Kembangan, formerly known as Serdang New Village, is a town located in Selangor, Malaysia. The town is now a considerable city in size - it is located near the northern end of the PLUS Expressway Southern Route .
/wiki/Golden_Screen_Cinemas: Golden Screen Cinemas Sdn Bhd (also known as GSC or GSCinemas) is the largest cinema chain in Malaysia. The biggest cinema is located within the Mid Valley Megamall. It houses 21 screen cinemas and has 2763 seats, making it the largest in Malaysia.
/wiki/Klang_Parade: Klang Parade is a shopping complex in Klang, Selangor, Malaysia with anchor tenants such as Econsave, Parkson, Golden Screen Cinemas and Peninsula College. Mini anchors include Kamdar, Dynasty Dragon, E-Digital, Mr DIY, Next Food Junction, Voir, Brands Outlet, and Original Classics (OC). As of March 2019, the mall's net lettable area (NLA) of 675,407 sq. ft. and it is reported to be 98.6%  tenanted.
/wiki/Subang_Jaya: Subang Jaya is a Municipality located in the Greater Kuala Lumpur (known as Klang Valley)  Petaling District, Selangor, Malaysia. It comprises the southern third district of Petaling. Consists of neighbourhoods from SS12 to SS19, PJS7/PJS9/PJS11 of Bandar Sunway (which are also partially jurisdictional within Petaling Jaya under the MBPJ), UEP Subang Jaya (USJ), Putra Heights and Batu Tiga, the municipal is governed by Subang Jaya Municipal Council (MPSJ), which also governs other areas of the Petaling district, such as Puchong and Seri Kembangan. According to the Subang Jaya Municipal Council (Malay: MPSJ), Subang Jaya has a population of 642,100 as of the year 2015.
/wiki/Selayang: Selayang is a town in Gombak District, Selangor, Malaysia. A new township, Bandar Baru Selayang is sited just 2 km away and was named after the town, where Majlis Perbandaran Selayang (MPS, English: Selayang Municipal Council) is located.
/wiki/List_of_cinemas_in_Malaysia: Malaysia has 169 cinemas operating throughout the country. The only states without cinemas are Perlis and Kelantan. The largest cinema operator is Golden Screen Cinemas. There are other large operators such as TGV Cinemas, MBO Cinemas, Lotus Five Star and mmCineplexes. Other than these operators, there are smaller operators who do screening on a small scale.
